repnme.cdata!: China - Ozone Depleting Substance Phaseout Projects

abstracts.cdata!:
This is the Implementation Completion
            Report (ICR) for the First and Second Ozone Depleting
            Substance (ODS) Projects in China. The ODS Projects have
            several objectives: (a) to support the Government's
            actions to reduce ODS consumption; (b) to establish a
            project implementation mechanism through local institutions;
            (c) to implement cost-effective, priority subprojects; and
            (d) to support the adoption and commercialization of 50
            percent reduced ODS foam applications. The objective of the
            projects to phase out ODS consumption of the 14 subprojects
            has been largely achieved. Compliance with project covenants
            by the enterprises was largely achieved. The following
            valuable lessons were drawn: (a) Policy enforcement is
            beyond subproject implementation scope. National
            Environmental Protection Agency (NEPA) plays a very
            important role in ensuring that complementary policy
            enforcement is in place; (b) More accurate ODS estimates are
            needed during project preparation and appraisal; (c) Project
            Implementation Schedule shows that although the projects
            were ultimately implemented correctly many inconveniences
            and extra work could have been avoided; (d) Suppliers must
            be carefully selected; (e) Clear and concise data at project
            preparation will help in project implementation and supervision.
